intro: Chamaesyce parannaquensis, commonly known as the Parannaquense sandwort, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This low-growing herb typically thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
